intro: Aster puniceus var. calderi, commonly known as the Caldeira aster, is a striking perennial plant native to the high-altitude regions of the Andes in South America. It is characterized by its vibrant purple to pink flowers that bloom in late summer and early fall. The plant features narrow, lance-shaped leaves with a silvery underside, giving it a distinctive appearance. It thrives in well-drained, rocky soils and requires full sun to partial shade. Due to its unique beauty and ecological significance, it is often cultivated in specialized gardens and conservation efforts.
